meanings.sent1: The curmudgeons in the neighborhood always grumble about the noise.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street is known as one of the curmudgeons.
meanings.sent3: The curmudgeons at the park scowled at the children playing.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was a real curmudgeon, never smiling or saying a kind word.
meanings.sent5: The curmudgeons in the office made everyone feel unwelcome with their constant complaints.

meanings.sent1: Despite being wealthy, he was a curmudgeon when it came to spending money.
meanings.sent2: The old lady was known as the town curmudgeon for her penny-pinching ways.
meanings.sent3: The curmudgeon refused to buy anything that wasn't on sale.
meanings.sent4: Her uncle was such a curmudgeon that he would reuse tea bags to save money.
meanings.sent5: The curmudgeon's house was filled with old, worn-out furniture that he refused to replace.
